title: How to Make a Brandy Manhattan

steps.headline: Add ice cubes to a martini shaker.
steps.description: No one wants a warm Manhattan, so get some ice to cool yourself on a sunny day.

steps.headline: Add 2  fl oz (59 mL) of brandy and 1  fl oz (30 mL) of sweet vermouth.
steps.description: These are the main ingredients that will give you that great flavor. Vermouth is fortified wine flavored with herbs and spices. For a "perfect" brandy Manhattan, use ⁄2  fl oz (15 mL) of dry vermouth and ⁄2  fl oz (15 mL) of sweet vermouth instead.

steps.headline: Stir your drink.
steps.description: Avoid shaking the mixture as it will result in a cloudy cocktail.

steps.headline: Put 2-3 dashes of bitters into a martini glass.
steps.description: You might want to chill the glass by placing it in the freezer for 3-4 hours. Then, to coat the glass, swirl the bitters around.

steps.headline: Strain the shaker into the martini glass.
steps.description: This is your chance to get rid of the ice cubes that could dilute your drink and take away the buzz. You can put a mesh strainer over the glass to catch the ice.

steps.headline: Add a garnish.
steps.description: No fancy drink is complete without a topping! A maraschino cherry will pair nicely with this drink, but if you're looking for a citrus kick, try an orange twist.

steps.headline: Put some ice in a glass.
steps.description: Fill your glass up about halfway with some ice cubes to create a cool beverage. Alternatively, you could chill the glass in the freezer beforehand so the ice cubes don't dilute your drink if they melt.

steps.headline: Add 1 ⁄2  fl oz (44 mL) of brandy and 0.2  fl oz (5.9 mL) of dry vermouth.
steps.description: The less dry vermouth you use, the drier the drink is. This differs from a "perfect" Manhattan which uses equal amounts of dry and sweet vermouth. Dry vermouth is more herbaceous and less spicy than sweet vermouth.

steps.headline: Stir the drink.
steps.description: It's better to stir than shake the liquid, as shaking it makes for a cloudy cocktail. Stirring also gives you a chance to distribute the ice so the drink is evenly chilled throughout.

steps.headline: Strain the mixture into a chilled martini glass.
steps.description: To keep your cocktail cold, stick a martini glass in the freezer a few hours before you intend to enjoy this cocktail. Then, grab it from the freezer and pour the liquid through a mesh strainer into the glass.

steps.headline: Add a garnish.
steps.description: A fruity topping would work, but if you want something salty with a Mediterranean flair, try an olive or 2! Savor the olives! They soak up the vermouth, giving them a unique taste.
